document_title: Atrial septal defect: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Many children with atrial septal defects will have no symptoms and remain healthy and lead normal lives. However, if the atrial septal defect is large, the patient may have some of the following signs and symptoms:
Fatigue easily;; Rapid breathing;; Shortness of breath;; Slow growth.; Frequent respiratory infections;; Heart arrhythmia.
Older children and adults with this congenital condition may experience migraines. However, there are still not many studies proving whether atrial septal defect is the cause of this condition or not.
